title: Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting Leaders Honored as Top Industry Influencers
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US 
RIVERWOODS, Ill. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- In its newly published list of the “Top 100 Most Influential People” for 2015, Accounting Todaynamed three Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting executives for the prestigious honor that recognizes the top thought leaders and visionaries shaping the accounting profession. This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150910006668/en/ Karen Abramson, Global CEO Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting (Photo: Business Wire) 
Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting Global CEO Karen Abramson was recognized for her leadership and ability to help the profession transition to the cloud. In Accounting Today’s own words, “Abramson provides steady leadership to one of the leading software and information providers to the profession, helping it surefootedly negotiate one of the greatest challenges the vendor community has yet to face — the move to the cloud.” 
Also making the prominent list are two members of Abramson’s Tax & Accounting Division Executive Team: Teresa Mackintosh, Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US, CCH Software President & CEO and Jason Marx, Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting US, CCH Small Firm Services President. Mackintosh was honored for her experience in the software space, valuable perspective of the tools Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting builds and her insight into the way accountants should use them. Marx was recognized for being a pioneer in bringing cloud-based practice management tools and portals to small accounting and tax firms. 
Accounting Today selected this group of thought leaders and change makers in the profession that includes top executives, CPAs, regulators, educators, attorneys and political figures. 
View the full list of Accounting Today’s “Top 100 Most Influential People” for 2015. 
About Wolters Kluwer 
Wolters Kluwer Tax & Accounting, a division of Wolters Kluwer, is a global leader in tax, accounting and audit software and solutions. Wolters Kluwer ( www.wolterskluwer.com ) is a market-leading global information services company. Wolters Kluwer had 2014 annual revenues of €3.7 billion ($4.2 billion), employs approximately 19,000 people worldwide, and maintains operations in over 40 countries across Europe, North America, Asia Pacific, and Latin America. Wolters Kluwer is headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands. Its shares are listed on NYSE Euronext Amsterdam (WKL), on Bloomberg (WKL NA)and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. Wolters Kluwer has a sponsored Level 1 American Depositary Receipt program. The ADRs are traded on the over-the-counter market in the U.S. (WTKWY).
